page.title: 07LOCAL INDUSTRY
page.content: cont. from page 6 My dad phones up the firm in Inverness and a man comes down in a van to give him the spare parts. At the back of the garage there are about fifty old cars and a few vans. At one time the yard was getting full up so my dad and uncle got a JCB to come in and dig a big hole in the soil near the beach. In about two days time it was finished and they pushed some of the cars into it. Then they filled it in. The garage is about four and a half miles from Cromarty and is the last building on the road out of Jemimaville village.
